channel.title: Spring JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [SWF-1482] Fileupload doesn't work in Richfaces 4.0.0 Final
item.description:
Hi,

Richfaces fileupload doesn't work in Spring Web Flow 2.3.0. After selecting a file and pressing the "Upload" button a "Server error" message shows up.
This error message originates from an exception in Richfaces method MultipartRequest.initialize() and states
"org.richfaces.exception.FileUploadException: The request was rejected because no multipart boundary was found".
It seems like MultipartRequest.initialize() is passed twice??? The FileUploadException occurs in the second pass.
Outside Spring Web Flow Richfaces fileupload works fine.

Regards
Gerhard Hofmann
item.summary: Fileupload doesn't work in Richfaces 4.0.0 Final

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Do you have a MultipartResolver configured in your Spring MVC configuration? If so the DispatcherServlet will detect and process multipart requests possibly interfering with RichFaces.
No, I haven't.

Ok so no interference from there. Something else to confirm is that you're not using Servlet 3.0 with multipart-config enabled. Probably not the case but worth verifying.

It would be very helpful if you could verify if MultipartRequest.initialize() is indeed called twice by placing a breakpoint and attaching the stack traces for each call. It might also help to post a question on the richfaces forum. Even though it works without Web Flow, the error occurs in RichFaces and understanding what can cause it would help to resolve it more quickly.

MultipartRequest.initialize() is indeed called twice - I've placed a breakpoint and copied the stack traces:

first call:

They're both at the start of a Web Flow request when the FlowFacesContextLifecycleListener creates the FlowFacesContext. Maybe those are two requests with a client-side redirect in between. Could you attach a log file with the execution of the request with 'org.springframework.webflow' at debug level and also (if possible) the relevant parts of the flow definition?
springwebflow.txt contains a trace of springwebflow logging and the relevant part of the flow definition.

In the log file there are two places marked "upload button pressed". I'm wondering if both of the above two stack traces occur each time a button is pressed. That would be puzzling since as far as I can see in the log, the web flow lifecycle occurs only once after the button is pressed. The stack traces above lead me to believe that the FlowFacesContextLifecycleListener.requestSubmitted() was somehow called twice for a single click, which would be odd.

Indeed, you get the two above stack traces each time the 'upload' button is pressed.
It looks like that the multipart request is handled twice within FlowFacesContext.newInstance(). At first handled by FacesContextFactoryImpl.getFacesContext() and once again by the constructor of Jsf2FlowFacesContext:

first call
MultipartRequest.initialize() line: 329
MultipartRequest.parseRequest() line: 361
FileUploadPartialViewContextFactory.getPartialViewContext(FacesContext) line: 134
ExtendedPartialViewContextFactoryImpl.getPartialViewContext(FacesContext) line: 43
FacesContextImpl.getPartialViewContext() line: 188
ExceptionHandlerFactoryImpl.getExceptionHandler() line: 65
FacesContextFactoryImpl.getFacesContext(Object, Object, Object, Lifecycle) line: 98
FlowFacesContext.newInstance(RequestContext, Lifecycle) line: 81
...

second call:
MultipartRequest.initialize() line: 329
MultipartRequest.parseRequest() line: 361
FileUploadPartialViewContextFactory.getPartialViewContext(FacesContext) line: 134
ExtendedPartialViewContextFactoryImpl.getPartialViewContext(FacesContext) line: 43
Jsf2FlowFacesContext.<init>(RequestContext, FacesContext) line: 57
FlowFacesContext.newInstance(RequestContext, Lifecycle) line: 85
...

Ok I see. We create the "default" FacesContext first and then wrap it with an instance of FlowFacesContext (or in this case Jsf2FlowFacesContext). That causes PartialViewContext to be created twice. Probably not an issue most of the times except with multipart requests, which should be parsed just once. The first access to PartialViewContextis in ExceptionHandlerFactoryImpl, which makes a call to facesContext.getPartialViewContext() and the second in Jsf2FlowFacesContext, which creates the PartialViewContext in order to provide with an instance to itself.

I don't see immediately what we can do here other than try to change the order of creation so that Jsf2FlowFacesContext itself creates the "default" FacesContext only after it has set itself as the current thread local instance and has also created the PartialViewContext.

There may be an option to delay the parsing of the request on the RichFaces side but I haven't looked at the source code.
I assume this is the same issue with Prime 3.0 file uploads. Any idea on when 2.3.1 is due? Nothing on the link above. Thanks.
Harry, can you provide a reference to the file upload issue with PrimeFaces 3.0?

Rossen, my difficulty with Prime 3.0 upload does not produce an exception and stack trace. I just cannot get it working, in an otherwise working, full-featured app (SWF, Spring Security, Hibernate).

According to a comment at this link, in the Spring example code, the upload case does not work, using Prime 2.2.1 I think.

https://src.springframework.org/svn/spring-samples/webflow-primefaces-showcase/src/main/webapp/WEB-INF/flows/file-upload/view.xhtml

The forums are full of talk about this, seems to be a problematic area.

Excuse me, this is supposed to be fixed.

http://code.google.com/p/primefaces/issues/detail?id=963

I could not get 2.2.1 to upload however. In 3.0 the init() method is called on the Prime upload filter, but the doFilter() method is not called. There is probably some config issue betw Faces and Spring that I cannot put my finger on.
It would be very helpful if you could help demonstrate the issue at the Spring Web Flow issue github repo. There are instructions and template projects to make it as easy as possible.

Is there any solution or work around for the File Upload issue. In my project we are facing the similar issue with File Upload . Spring Web Flow 2.2.1 and Rich Faces 4.1.0. Is this issue with higher versions of 2.0 where Jsf2FlowFacesContext is created. Is replacing Jsf2FlowFacesContext with FlowFacesContext will help? Please advice.

@Gerhard, I've started a project to reproduce the issue. The main pieces are there but the FileUploadBean listener method is not getting invoked. Would you mind taking a look at it and compare to your project? You can comment here or on the commit or submit a pull request.
Postponing till we can have the issue reproduced.

I've encountered the same issue while using SWF 2.3 and Richfaces. The "org.richfaces.exception.FileUploadException" described in original issue is thrown while using richfaces 4.0.x Final. When i change lib to richfaces 4.2.x Final the exception isn't thrown, just the FileUploadBean listener method is not being called. Everything works fine outside webflow.
Phil Webb, it looks like I never updated the issue. It is now reproducible. The upload appears to work but the FileUploadBean never gets called.

This is now fixed, there is an example project available here:

https://github.com/SpringSource/spring-webflow-issues/tree/master/SWF-1482

The reference documentation has also been updated with some examples.
